ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: HIST 631 is a survey of the historiography in micro and macrohistory. It offers an invaluable opportunity for students to orient themselves within the global turn. I would definitely recommend this course to another student.

HIST 631 will ask you to read a number of authors grappling with the issue of scope in historical research. Not only would I recommend this course to another student, but I think it should be a requirement for any future historians in the department.
Definitely, anyone from any field should take this class.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course deepened my understanding of one of the most important trends in recent historiography: the global turn. It inspired me to begin bridging the gap between micro/macro perspectives in my own research with methods such as descriptive statistics.
This course was extremely helpful methodologically.
I learned so much on the historical period, European history and historiography.
It was very helpful in showing me how to do quatative research and in thinking what micro history really is
